bitfield.description: int_eos through bit 0: LSE does the process for slice boundary after receiving int_eos. 1: int_eos is passed through to SYNCBOX without the process for slice boundary

OCP error status bit [11]: OCP DMA IP_CORE side [10]: OCP DMA SL2 side [9]: OCP CFG IP_CORE side 0: When Sresp is not ERR 1: When Sresp is ERR Writing 0 is ignored. These bits will remain 1 until RESET or until host sets to 1.
Status Adaptv_add() value This signal is cleared, if TOKEN_CLR = 1.

LSE internal signals will be initialized to understand prologue (first macroblock) as follows: - token status signal - token start/end signal - DMA pointer Writing 0 is ignored. Writing 1 clears some internal signal. This is a self clearing bit. The host will always read '0'. If this is not used for initialization at prologue, some internal signal is kept. Also, synchronization does not function well.
Single-step mode 1: Enable single-step mode 0: Normal mode

Disabled internal BFSW change 0: Enable internal BFSW change (default) Then, LSE controls BFSW after LD task finishes. 1: Disable BFSW change (If host wants to control BFSW with each task step by step with LD_GO, COMP_GO, and ST_GO.)
Command status bit 0: LSE command is defined 1: LSE command is undefined Writing 0 is ignored This bit will remain 1 until RESET or TOKEN_CLR or until host sets to 1.

Execute LOAD task on bypass mode Target ParamAddr_ld_byps needs to be set before this bit is set. 1: Execute LD task. LSE access to ParamAddr_ld_byps and execute the command for LOAD task. 0: Idle Writing 0 is ignored. This bit is cleared after LD Task finishes.

Execute Comp task on bypass mode 1: Execute ‘Comp task’. In the single-step mode, LSE access to ParamAddr_ld_byps and execute the command for Comp task. In the normal mode, LSE executes COMP commands followed by LD commands. 0: Idle Writing 0 is ignored. This bit is cleared after Comp Task finished.

Execute Store task on bypass mode. Target ParamAddr_st_byps need to set before this bit is set. 1: Execute Store task. LSE access to ParamAddr_st_byps and execute the command for Store task. 0: Idle Writing 0 is ignored This bit is cleared after ST Task finished.
SYNCBOX bypass mode: 1: LSE functions SYNCBOX bypass mode and executes the task of GO_BIT. 0: LSE function normal SYNCBOX mode and waits NewTaskSignal. This value should not change during execution.

register.description: Parameter address for SB bypass mode

bitfield.description: Only used in bypass mode. Address of the first command of LD and COMP sequence (128-bit word unit). This is a 128-bit word address, not a byte address. The conversion from byte address to 128-bit word address should be done by the CPU. If LSE_CTRL SB_BYPS is 1, this value is used. In bypass mode, this address is given by this field, instead of SYNCBOX. This field is also used in single-step mode.

Only used in the bypass mode. Address of the first command of ST sequence [128-bit word unit]. This is 128-bit word address, not byte address. The conversion from byte address to 128-bit word address should be done by CPU. If LSE_CTRL SB_BYPS is 1, this value is used. In the bypass mode, this address is given via this field, instead via SYNCBOX. This field is also used in single-step mode.
